website_summaries.verdict: A slim, under-the-counter appliance for the kitchen that's designed for recyclable products but not food waste.
pros: Manufacturer promises permanent crushing with "Hypercrush" feature
cons: It's pricier than some other options, and isn't for food waste

customer_reviews.title: Krusher 12”
customer_reviews.text: Only 12” trash compactor on the market so I kind to have to love it or remodel my kitchen. This purchase was the less expensive option. The Krushr is 100% more quiet than the GE monogram it replaced. It’s so quiet my wife has a hard time knowing when it is running. I’d give it 5 stars but the Blue LED stopped working within 2 days of installation. The Stainless Steel door was super easy to install. The included toe-kick was more difficult and never quite fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Trashbags hard to find
customer_reviews.text: The Krushr works as advertised, but doesn't pack as much trash into the receptacle as our previous trash compactor (Broan). It is overpriced and the trash bags are not standard size that can be purchased at our local store, such as Costco. We were limited on selection for a 12 inch trash compactor as these appliances are not as popular as they once were. Also, there was a large opening as the base after installation that we had to cover with leftover cabinet paneling.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Fills the Void of Broan 12" Compactor
customer_reviews.text: It does the Job. Took Long time to get. Over a month to get. Glad it is over with. Delivery Service Workers were Great.
customer_reviews.author: JoeKid

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising
customer_reviews.text: Bought the trash compactor. It came with no panel. You need to read deep into it to see that the panel is not included. If it’s not included why Show it on the ad. Deceptive advertising
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work like other trash compactors and I am super disappointed. Especially for what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Bane

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Krusher. Uses special bags. Not expensive. But manual does not tell you which bag your Krusher uses. Just guessed. Got it right. Bought 12” Krusher. Ordered only bag with the number 12 in it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Odom

customer_reviews.title: Great compactor.
customer_reviews.text: Great compactor... 12 inch to replace Broan model no longer made. Quiet and lighter than Broan yet does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Roope

customer_reviews.title: It’s not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: It’s not strong enough for compacting you have to lock it all the time and even its not enough
customer_reviews.author: Rejean cliche

customer_reviews.title: Will not stand behind warranty
customer_reviews.text: The warranty clearly states that parts are covered by two year warranty.They will not stand behind it. After many emails to their customer service in England, they said they are working on a new design for their RAM. This should not effect my warranty at all. However, like the previous three reviews their customer service is horrible. We had to buy this compactor because it is the only one that would fit in a 13 inch space. Do your self a favor and buy American.
customer_reviews.author: Bradr19

customer_reviews.title: Worst trash compactor ever!
customer_reviews.text: Worst trash compactors ever! Don’t buy one. Go with a GE or Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 compaction of a Broan compactor
customer_reviews.text: This is not a true trash compactor like the Broan I had before this. It is a recycling compactor and I find that I get about half the compaction of the Broan. Since I needed a 12" wide compactor it was my only choice. It is nice looking very quiet & very expensive. Other than less compaction the only other problem I have had is the bag catching on the compaction ram and tearing. I am only on my second bag so I think I will find a resolution to solve this.
customer_reviews.author: grammybird

product_meta.title: Krushr K012 Panel Required Recycle Compactor, 12-Inch
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Across the Globe there is a growing requirement to reduce landfill by recycling plastics, metals, paper and glass. Made in Britain, Krushr’s range of stylish modern household recycle compactors are quiet in operation and enable you to segregate your recycling waste. Not only do they look good, they also offer a neat and convenient solution for the environmentally conscious consumer. Krushr's K012 12" Panel Required Compactor features a remarkably quiet touch button operation with a hyper crush facility that gives you optimum compaction (averaging 85% ratio depending on material type) allowing you to fill the bin several times reducing the number of trips to the outside bin. This compactor absorbs 5.5 cubic feet of uncrushed recycling including plastic, food packaging, card, paper, drink cans, food tins and more. This unit is ideal for apartments, boats, offices and where space may be limited. Krushr Compactors are also available in 15", 18", 21", and 24".
feature_bullets: PLEASE NOTE: the door panel shown in the image is for illustration purposes only and is not included. For a Stainless Steel finish, Krushr offers a 12" stainless steel door tailored to this unit that (sold separately).
Custom fit bags available to keep the interior clean and easy to empty (sold separately) with Touch Button Operation and Child Lock Safety
This unit can be installed floor mount standalone, fully integrated or built under counter
Energy efficient hyper crush mode maintaining compaction force without the use of energy
Removable legs that can extend up to 1" allowing a maximum total height of 34.69"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars8 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
